common

Class ImageFileInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.ImageFileInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ImageFileInputStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Utility for reading binary data from image files with configurable byte order.

    This class wraps an InputStream and provides methods to read signed and unsigned values of various primitive types, for example: readShort(), readUnsignedInteger(), or readFloat(), while keeping track of the current read position. Both big-endian and little-endian formats are supported.

    The byte order can be changed at any time via setByteOrder(ByteOrder).

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Method Detail

      • setByteOrder

        public void setByteOrder(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Sets the byte order used for interpreting multi-byte values.

        For example, reading the byte sequence 0x01 0x02 0x03 0x04 as a 4-byte integer yields 0x01020304 in big-endian order, and 0x04030201 in little-endian order.

        Parameters:
        order - the byte order to use, either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN. It must not be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if order is null

      • skip

        public void skip(long n)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Skips n bytes in the stream, guaranteeing that the stream position is advanced by exactly that amount, unless the end of the stream is reached.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of bytes to skip. Must be non-negative
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs or the stream ends prematurely
